intro: Onobrychis arenaria f. mareotica, commonly known as the Mareotic clover, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of the Mediterranean. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or calcareous soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological niche, making it a subject of interest in botanical studies. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
